Description: St Antony Abbot; whole-length standing to front, with long beard, holding a staff in the crook of his arm and reading a book. Pen and brown ink
Curator's comments: This drawing of St Anthony was associated by Winkler with Dürer's engravings of the apostles St Thomas and St Paul of 1514, two of five prints of an incomplete series of apostles engraved by Dürer between 1514 and 1526 (Meder 45, 47-50 ). The standing position against little or no background setting is a characteristic of all five prints, but although this drawing is of a similar format, it is not necessarily connected with the series. It is considerably smaller (about 88 X 52 mm, as against approximately117 X 74 mm for the engravings) and has little indication of the bulk of the drapery which is a feature of the engraved figures. Nor is it connected with Dürer's later engraving of St Anthony of 1519 (Meder 51) which shows the saint seated with the addition of an elaborate landscape background, taken from his earlier pen and ink drawing ‘Pupila Augusta’ (The Royal Collection, Windsor Castel; Winkler, ‘Dürer’, i, pl. 153). The Tietzes and Panofsky had reservations about the attribution of this lightly-sketched drawing, but it is of a fine enough quality to be by Dürer and should be dated c. 1514 -15. Lit from J.
